item.title: Huma add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "In vain have I struggled. It will not do. My feelings will not be repressed. You must allow me to tell you how ardently I admire and love you." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Huma add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Yeah, Quirrell was a great teacher. There was just that minor drawback of him having Lord Voldemort sticking out of the back of his head!" -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Huma add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "He could tell at once that they carried different sorts of bubble bath mixed with the water though it wasn't bubble bath as Harry had ever experienced. One tap gushed pink and blue bubbles the size of footballs; another poured ice-white foam so thick that Harry thought it would have supported his weight if he'd cared to test it; a third sent heavily perfumed purple clouds hovering over the surface of the water. Harry amused himself for a while turning the taps on and off, particularly enjoying the effect of one whose jet bounced off the surface of the water in large arcs." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Huma add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I do not want people to be very agreeable, as it saves me the trouble of liking them a great deal." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Huma add a quote by Anna Quindlen
item.description: "Books are the plane, and the train, and the road. They are the destination, and the journey. They are home." -- Anna Quindlen

item.title: Huma add a quote by Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus
item.description: "When I have a little money, I buy books; and if I have any left, I buy food and clothes." -- Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus

item.title: Huma add a quote by Horace Mann
item.description: "A house without books is like a room without windows." -- Horace Mann

item.title: Huma add a quote by Gilbert Highet
item.description: "Books are not lumps of lifeless paper, but minds alive on shelves!" -- Gilbert Highet

item.title: Huma add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Huma add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is no friend as loyal as a book." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Huma add a quote by Mario Puzo
item.description: "A friend should always underestimate your virtues and an enemy overestimate your faults" -- Mario Puzo

item.title: Huma add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Huma add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Huma add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Huma add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Huma add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Huma add a quote by Arthur Schopenhauer
item.description: "Talent hits a target no one else can hit. Genius hits a target no one else can see." -- Arthur Schopenhauer

item.title: Huma add a quote by Mario Puzo
item.description: "Tell my father I wish to be his son." -- Mario Puzo

item.title: Huma add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "It is hard to fail, but it is worse never to have tried to succeed." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: Huma add a quote by Agatha Christie
item.description: "If you are to be Hercule Poirot, you must think of everything." -- Agatha Christie

item.title: Huma add a quote by Agatha Christie
item.description: "Hercule Poirot: I am an imbecile. I see only half of the picture. Miss Lemon: I don't even see that." -- Agatha Christie

item.title: Huma add a quote by Agatha Christie
item.description: "Never do anything yourself that others can do for you." -- Agatha Christie

item.title: Huma add a quote by Agatha Christie
item.description:
"Curious things, habits. People themselves never knew they had them.
[Witness for the Prosecution, also published in The Hound of Death and Other Stories.]" -- Agatha Christie

item.title: Huma add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "Those who dream by day are cognizant of many things which escape those who dream only by night." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Huma add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "All that we see or seem is but a dream within a dream." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Huma add a quote by Mark Haddon
item.description: "Prime numbers are what is left when you have taken all the patterns away. I think prime numbers are like life. They are very logical but you could never work out the rules, even if you spent all your time thinking about them." -- Mark Haddon

item.title: Huma add a quote by Tamora Pierce
item.description: "Curiosity killed the cat,” Fesgao remarked, his dark eyes unreadable. Aly rolled her eyes. Why did everyone say that to her? “People always forget the rest of the saying,” she complained. “‘And satisfaction brought it back." -- Tamora Pierce

item.title: Huma add a quote by Daniel Pennac
item.description:
"Reader's Bill of Rights
1. The right to not read
2. The right to skip pages
3. The right to not finish
4. The right to reread
5. The right to read anything
6. The right to escapism
7. The right to read anywhere
8. The right to browse
9. The right to read out loud
10. The right to not defend your tastes" -- Daniel Pennac

item.title: Huma add a quote by Henry Ward Beecherr
item.description: "Where is human nature so weak as in the bookstore?" -- Henry Ward Beecherr

item.title: Huma add a quote by Tamora Pierce
item.description: "You didn't kill him. He would have killed you, but you didn't kill him." "So? He was stupid. If I killed everyone who was stupid, I wouldn't have time to sleep." -- Tamora Pierce
